message:
China: Beijing hosts the world's largest robot conference.
The main attraction at the conference was 27 human-like robots that walked around the conference island.
Reactions on social networks to the arrest of the founder of Telegram in France:

The chairman of the Palestinian Authority, Abu Mazen, arrived in Saudi Arabia this evening for an unplanned visit. He is expected to meet the Saudi crown prince tomorrow.

Abu Mazen was also accompanied by the Secretary General of the PLO Working Committee, Hossein al-Sheikh and the head of Palestinian intelligence, Majed Faraj.

IDF: Following the sirens that sounded at 18:36 in the Upper Galilee area, a number of suspicious aerial targets were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory.  A number of fallen projectiles were identified in the area. No injuries were reported. 

Additionally, following the sirens that sounded at 18:59 in the Western Galilee area, a number of suspicious aerial targets were identified approaching Israeli territory from Lebanon. The IDF Aerial Defense Array successfully intercepted most of them. A fallen projectile was identified in the area. No injuries were reported. 

Sirens regarding rocket and missile launches were activated due to the possibility of falling shrapnel from the interception.

The military wing of Hamas publishes documentation of the launch of the M-90 rocket yesterday towards Rishon Lezion.

According to the IDF spokesman, the launcher was destroyed after launch.

Al Jazeera: Hezbollah attacked the north of Israel with drones and rockets at the same time as the Israeli Chief of Staff and his American counterpart, the chairman of the US Joint Chiefs of Staff, were visiting the north.

French President Macron on the arrest in France of the founder of Telegram, Pavel Durov (who also holds Russian citizenship):

The arrest is not political. The decision is in the hands of the judges.

Hachem Haidar, Chairman of the South Lebanon Council with statistics on the results of the war on the Lebanese side:

619 dead in Lebanon since the beginning of the war.
About 2000 wounded.
4,000 houses were completely destroyed.
20,000 houses were partially damaged.

The dimensions of the destruction now in southern Lebanon are equal to about 40-50 percent of what was caused in the Second Lebanon War in 2006 (which also included a ground maneuver in Lebanon - AA).

Lebanese sources: The roof of an apartment in Tyre fell in as a result of breaking the sound barrier by Israeli warplanes today.
Significant damage was caused.

##
The building standards could use some changes...

The Palestinians report 5 deaths in a vehicle attack near the Khan Yunis anchorage in Mawasi (west of Khan Yunis).
Among the dead is the journalist Ali Teima - identified with Fatah.

Lebanese channels report fear and concern among the residents of Bint Jabil district in southern Lebanon, due to the uncertainty as the beginning of the school year approaches - they do not know if schools will open in their area and what will happen to the students who were displaced from southern Lebanon.
The Lebanese Ministry of Education has not provided answers.

The Iranian Chief of Staff on Hezbollah's attack: what we saw yesterday is part of the revenge for the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh

Is Iran trying to piggyback on Hezbollah's revenge and seeking to lower expectations?

Mohammad Bagheri, the Iranian Chief of Staff, at the swearing in of the new Iranian Defense Minister:

Tehran cannot forget the elimination of Haniyeh and the revenge for it, whether it will be carried out by the resistance axis or by Iran, it is a done deal.

Iran will determine the method of revenge and the appropriate time for it and will not fall into the trap that the media are laying for it.

The Axis will avenge the assassination of Haniyeh, each according to his ability and plan and what we saw yesterday is part of it.

##
This is a retreat by Iran from the bombastic and threatening statements of the first week after the assassination in Tehran.

Cold feet? The need to avenge the assassination has become a heavy burden on Iran.
Did I already say that they are jealous of Hezbollah?

Palestinian journalist Muhammad Badar from Ramallah was released today after 10 months in Israeli prison.

He lost a few chins in prison.

The Egyptian "Al-Qahara" channel, close to the regime, according to a senior Egyptian source:

Egypt has repeatedly emphasized to all parties in the negotiations that it does not accept any Israeli presence at the Rafah crossing or the Philadelphi axis.

##
This is an important report so that everyone will understand how much the leading mediators in the negotiations (including Qatar of course) are biased in favor of Hamas.
If the mediator has such a clear interest against a central position of one of the parties in the negotiations, how can he act as a mediator? He is abnormally biased. He has a conflict of interest.

Crowding on the coastline in Deir al-Balah following the evacuation instructions.

The pressure on the residents of Deir al-Balah is intensifying. This is also noticeable in discussions online.

An interesting report in Russian media about the attack in Sidon 👆:
Amar Khlikhel, a senior member of Hamas, was the target of the attack in Sidon and he was seriously injured as well as some of his family members.

##
Unofficial Lebanese channels do not specify the name of the target of the attack but claim that the target was slightly injured, contrary to the Russian report.
Since yesterday at 15:00 until now, Hezbollah has not accepted responsibility for any attack on Israel.

Lebanese sources reported earlier this afternoon that Israeli fighter jets broke the sound barrier in the skies of southern Lebanon.

These sources also report that Hezbollah subsequently launched an air-to-ground missile at the planes in the skies of southern Lebanon.

The Lebanese Al Mayadeen channel claims: the target of the attack in Sidon was saved.

The Almanar network and the Lebanese Al Akhbar channel also rushed to announce that the target of the attack in Sidon had been saved.

The common denominator for all 3 of these media: they are identified with Hezbollah..

Lebanese channels: An Israeli drone attacked a Honda CRV at the entrance to the village of Ibra in Sidon (about 50 km north of the border with Israel).
According to Lebanese sources, there are casualties.
Lutsk, Ukraine: An Iranian-made Shahad 136 UAV (used by Russia) dives towards a residential building.

The municipality of Deir al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip:

Nearly 250,000 people evacuated Deir al-Balah during the last 72 hours following the evacuation instructions of the Israeli army.

4 additional water wells have become out of our reach and a total of 14 wells, which would have provided 70% of the drinking water for the residents are not in use.

Aid organizations have begun to leave the area.

Remember the "work accident" 👆 from 5 days ago when an explosive device went off in the Tammun area, in southern Tubas, and one of the terrorists had his lower limbs amputated?

Well, his name was Yazan Maslamani, one of the senior members of the "Tubas Battalion" of the Islamic Jihad - and he died today of his wounds.

Dug his own grave...

North Korea reveals today, in the presence of the supreme leader, a new suicide drone of its own production.

Soon to be seen in the Middle East and Ukraine?

A fire was still burning yesterday on board the Greek oil tanker SOUNION.
It was attacked by the Houthis last week.

In contrast to the Lebanese Al Akhbar newspaper, the more accepted equation on social networks is - a head for a head:

The head of the Hezbollah Chief of Staff for the head of a chicken.

(It's worth watching the attached video).

The Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper, which is affiliated with Hezbollah, has an explosive headline:

Hezbollah established an equation - Tel Aviv for Dahiyeh.

##
Hezbollah is trying to frame the narrative...

Social media users didn't buy it👇👇👇

The chickens don't stop chasing Nasrallah and Hezbollah on social media

In my opinion, Hezbollah has never regretted launching a rocket like the one that hit the chicken coop yesterday.

Some of the posts on social networks:

1. The occupation government decided to move the chicken coops to the Negev after intelligence reports arrived that Hezbollah intended to attack the chickens with strategic missiles.

2. Nasrallah: The enemy must understand that there is no more KFC after today.

3. Nasrallah: The enemy must know - if you attack our senior officers, we will attack your chickens.

4. Hezbollah yesterday intensively, strategically and metaphysically attacked the chicken coops in response to the assassination of Fuad Shukr. His head was worth a thousand chicken heads!

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza:

Following the evacuation instructions of the IDF spokesperson, according to which the Shuhada Al-Aqsa hospital in Deir al-Balah is in the vicinity of a combat zone, there was panic among the patients and some of them fled the hospital for fear that the IDF would break into it.

We emphasize that the Shuhada Al Aqsa Hospital continues to operate and that the medical staff remains with 100 patients in the hospital.

We demand protection for the hospital and those staying there.

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza:
1.26 million polio vaccines entered the Gaza Strip. We are now preparing for a vaccination campaign.

##
These additional vaccines entered through Israel, of course.

France: The arrest of the founder of Telegram was extended

French media reports that the detention of Pavel Durov, the founder of Telegram, has been extended for investigation purposes.
According to French law, the detention can be extended up to 96 hours, after which Durov will be released or an indictment will be filed against him.

The Telegram company responded to his arrest and stated that it complies with all the conditions of the law used in the European Union, including the Digital Services Law, like the other companies in this industry.
According to the company, Durov has nothing to hide and travels frequently throughout the European Union. It also stated that it is ridiculous to accuse the platform itself or its owner of responsibility for inappropriate use of the platform.

Iranian Foreign Minister:
There will be an Iranian response to Israel's terrorist attack in Tehran.

##
The Iranians are jealous of Nasrallah. They would be happy to be like him, after the "powerful revenge" they promised with  grandiose threats, all without causing a shred of escalation.

A Gazan reacts to the results of the round of talks in Cairo:
Everyone lies.
And the only truth is that only we die.

The failure of the talks in Cairo

Reuters from two Egyptian security sources:

The negotiation talks in Cairo ended without an agreement.
Hamas and Israel did not agree on the proposals of the mediators.

The Egyptian sources doubted the chances of success of the efforts to reach an agreement.

At the same time, a senior American source told Reuters that the talks were "constructive" and in an atmosphere where all parties wanted to reach an agreement...

##
There is nothing new under the sun... There is no agreement between Hamas and Israel on fundamental issues, which are black and white. This does not prevent the Americans from continuing to scatter celebratory confetti around...

Another unusual event last night:

IDF: an explosive device was detonated on a civilian bus in the area of the town of Marah Rabah. Damage was caused to the bus. No injuries were reported.

Yesterday's ramming attack in Ariel:

The attack was carried out by two Islamic Jihad terrorists from the Jenin refugee camp.

IDF: Following the initial report, two terrorists in a vehicle arrived from the direction of the Tapu'ah Junction to the entrance of Ariel and accelerated in the opposite direction of traffic. Their vehicle collided with other vehicles and attempted to ram IDF soldiers operating in the area. The soldiers eliminated the terrorists and located a military vest and ammunition in the vehicle.

As a result of the ramming attack, an IDF soldier was lightly injured and was evacuated to the hospital to receive medical treatment and his family has been notified.
